title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central Provinces and in Galle and Matara Districts.

title: Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe earns ‘A’ grade in Global Finance’s Central Banker Report Cards 2025
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, has been awarded a prestigious “A” grade in Global Finance’s 2025 Central Banker Report Card.

title: Massive Russian attack on Kyiv kills at least 23, damages EU and British offices
byline: Russia pounded Ukraine with deadly missiles and drone strikes early on Thursday in a sweeping attack that the U.S. special envoy on Ukraine said undermined President Donald Trump’s peace efforts.

title: Corruption in any form undermines governance and public trust – PM
byline: The inaugural workshop of a program series organized by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, in collaboration with the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, and Local Government, was held yesterday (28) at the Western Provincial Council Auditorium in Battaramulla.

title: Two arrested over shooting of former prison officer in Bandaragama
byline: Two suspects have been arrested for aiding and abetting the shooting of a former prison officer near the Bolgoda Bridge in the Bandaragama Police Division.

title: Over 14,800 children reported in vulnerable situations in Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Probation and Child Care Services has revealed that around 14,834 children have been identified as being in vulnerable situations across the island.

title: South Korea’s ex-first lady Kim Keon Hee indicted on bribery charges
byline: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of South Korea’s ousted former President Yoon Suk Yeol, has been indicted for bribery and other charges, a special prosecution team said on Friday (Aug 29), amid a widening probe into the country’s martial law crisis and scandals involving the once powerful couple.

title: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne appears before court
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who had been issued a warrant for his arrest, appeared before the Colombo High Court today (29).

title: 85-year-old woman stabbed to death in Walasmulla
byline: An 85-year-old elderly woman has been stabbed to death with a sharp weapon in the Udagahawatte area of the Walasmulla Police Division.

title: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne remanded until Sep. 9
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who appeared before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (29), has been remanded until September 09.

title: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne remanded
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who appeared before the Colombo High Court today (29), has been remanded.

title: ASPI crosses 21,000 for the first time
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) surpassed the 21,000-point mark for the first time in history, during this morning’s (29) trading session.

title: Former MP Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero appears before court
byline: Former Member of Parliament Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero has appeared before the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court this morning (29), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Ukraine’s “Largest” naval ship sunk in Russia’s first sea drone attack
byline: Ukrainian Navy’s reconnaissance ship Simferopol, which was reportedly the largest ship commissioned by the country in over a decade, has been hit and sunk in a naval drone strike, the Russian Defence Ministry announced on Thursday.

title: Former MP Nimal Lanza arrested
byline: Former Member of Parliament Nimal Lanza was arrested today (29) after surrendering to the Kochchikade Police.

title: Former MP Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero remanded
byline: Former Member of Parliament Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero has been remanded until September 12 after appearing before the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: New Rs. 2,000 commemorative note presented to the President
byline: Marking the 75th Anniversary of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), a new commemorative Rs. 2,000 currency note was presented this morning (29) to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat by the Governor of the Central Bank, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, has been further remanded until September 12 by the Colombo Magistrate.

title: Former President Ranil discharged from hospital
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was receiving treatment at the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the Colombo National Hospital, has been discharged from the hospital, a short while ago.

title: Former State Minister Nimal Lanza remanded
byline: Former State Minister Nimal Lanza, who was arrested today (29) after surrendering to the Kochchikade Police, has been remanded until September 12 by the Negombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Thai court removes Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office
byline: Thailand’s Constitutional Court on Friday dismissed Paetongtarn Shinawatra from her position as prime minister, ruling that as the country’s leader she violated constitutional rules on ethics in a phone call with Cambodia’s Senate President Hun Sen.

title: India’s International Booker winner at the centre of a political row
byline: International Booker Prize winning-author Banu Mushtaq has found herself in the midst of a controversy after she was invited to inaugurate a prominent festival in the southern Indian state of Karnataka.

title: Egypt rounds up teenaged TikTokkers in crackdown on social media
byline: Egyptian authorities have been rounding up teenaged TikTokkers with millions of followers, detaining dozens in recent weeks on accusations ranging from violating family values to laundering money.

title: Woman and child nabbed with underworld figures in Indonesia repatriated
byline: The woman and the small child who were arrested along with several most-wanted Sri Lankan underworld criminal figures, including ‘Kehelbaddara’ Padme, while in Indonesia, have been were brought to the island this evening (29).

title: Sri Lankan MPs delegation meets India’s Speaker, discuss boosting parliamentary ties
byline: In a significant step towards deepening democratic ties, the 24-member high-level delegation of Sri Lanka-India Parliamentary Friendship Association met India’s Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla during their visit to the Parliamentary Research and Training Institute for Democracies (PRIDE) at Lok Sabha Secretariat in New Delhi.

title: Colombo’s consumer price index rises on-year in August, first time in twelve months
byline: Sri Lanka’s Colombo consumer price index rose 1.2% year-on-year in August, after falling 0.3% in July, the statistics department said on Friday.

title: Madushanka’s last-over hat-trick powers Sri Lanka to a thriller win
byline: Sri Lankan left-arm seamer Dilshan Madushanka produced a sensational last-over hat-trick to snatch victory from Zimbabwe in a dramatic ODI clash, sealing a 7-run win in Hambantota.
